q_en: I am from The Hong Kong Polytechnic University. Today is July 2, 2024. Please help me create an order for 50 red T-shirts in size M and 30 blue sweaters in size XL.

steps.sql: INSERT INTO orders (user_id, order_name, created_at) VALUES ((SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'PolyU'), 'Order for July 2, 2024', '2024-07-02'); INSERT INTO order_product (order_id, product_id, number) VALUES ((SELECT id FROM orders WHERE order_name = 'Order for July 2, 2024'), (SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE p.attributes = 'Red, M size' AND pt.description = 'T-shirt'), 50), ((SELECT id FROM orders WHERE order_name = 'Order for July 2, 2024'), (SELECT p.id FROM products p JOIN products_types pt ON p.products_type_id = pt.id WHERE p.attributes = 'Blue, XL size' AND pt.description = 'Sweater'), 30);
steps.description: Insert a new order for the customer 'PolyU' with the specified products and quantities. First, find the customer ID for 'PolyU', then find the product IDs for 'Red, M size' T-shirt and 'Blue, XL size' Sweater, and finally insert the order and order products.

response:
Sure thing! ğŸ‰ Your order has been successfully created. Here's a summary of your order details:
